translated: Tattvaratnavalī by Vimalasiva, a South Indian Siddhantin. This is a brief liturgical manual for the basic rites of Siddhānta Śaivism. The first chapter deals with the regular daily rite Nitya and the second with the occasional rite Naimittika performed on special festive occasions. The third chapter deals with the worship of the basic Navanābha Mandala with nine sections. Eight arranged around the central one each containing nine parts of the pada of the Vyomavya-pin mantra which is the standard mantra of Siddhānta Śaivism which begins with the invocation of Sadāśiva as Vyomavyāpin, i.e. as the one who pervades the sky.
